newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - Sterling consolidates, eyes 2.80 marks.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - Sterling consolidates, eyes 2.80 marks.

text.p: Sterling seems determined to revisit highs above 2.80 marks but the cross is likely to consolidate sideways before attempting a further push to the upside, said analysts.
Sterling/mark stumbled to lows around 2.7600 on Wednesday before recovering nearly three pfennigs to 2.7890 marks in late Europe. At 0737 GMT today it stood at 2.7860/70 marks.
"I see the downside limited now. I think sterling/mark is pausing for breath and looking for a break above the 2.80 figure," said Nick Shamin, currency analyst at London-based Technical Data.
Shamin, however, said the cross would have to push through tough resistance around 2.7975 marks - Wednesday's high - to confirm its upside potential.
Steep trendline support, beginning at lows around 2.7240 marks on May 12 and lows of 2.7810 marks on May 15, will cushion any slip, said analysts.

"Before we see a resumption in the pound's long-term uptrend and a sustained attack on the 3.00 level, the British unit will undergo an extensive downward contra-trend correction to the 200-day moving average at 2.5680," said Howard Wright, chief technical analyst at Prisma Market Analysis.
